intro: Leucopholis longifolia, commonly known as the long-leaved greenwood, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, white pubescence. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow and are arranged in clusters, making it an attractive addition to gardens. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid forests.
